docs.snippet: NATIONALIST China is not abandoning postage stamps. On February 1 this column  reprinted a report from a West Berlin paper, "Berliner Extra Dienst," under a heading "Stamps Abolished?" in which it was reported that "for some months postage stamps...
docs.lead_paragraph: NATIONALIST China is not abandoning postage stamps. On February 1 this column reprinted a report from a West Berlin paper, "Berliner Extra Dienst," under a heading "Stamps Abolished?" in which it was reported that "for some months postage stamps have no longer been used by China's overseas post office."
docs.abstract: GB reptdly refusing to accept mail from Rhodesia with new stamps that do not have por of Queen Elizabeth II: asks similar ban by other countries

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 6 Allegations that the Uruguayan police regularly torture political prisoners have prompted a Congressional investigation and set off a Government scandal here.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 6 Allegations that the Uruguayan police regularly torture political prisoners have prompted a Congressional investigation and set off a Government scandal here.
docs.abstract: Testimony of police officers, male metal worker and woman med worker that Uruguayan police regularly torture pol prisoners prompts Cong probe and sets off Govt scandal; allegations of torture detailed; Interior Min Cersosimo, Montevideo police chief Col Zina and police intelligence chief Otero deny use of torture; backing of Cersosimo by Pres Pacheco seen in Cersosimo's retention in office despite Pacheco's replacement of 3 other key mins; current charges of torture have not been censored in press; Pacheco seen letting probe take its course with possible new curbs on police; growing harshness of police methods linked to Govt determination to crush Tupamaros, group of left-wing urban guerrillas; theft of safe containing 441 lbs of gold by Tupamaros, largest robbery in country's history, noted; continuation of ltd state of siege, imposed in June '69, aimed at halting rioting, terrorism and guerrilla activity noted

headline.main: Charges That Police in Uruguay Torture Political Prisoners Stir Scandal

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Brazil, April 6 (UPI) Tom Koch beat Jaime Fillol today in the final singles, 6-I, 6-3, 4-6, 4-6, 8-6, to give Brazil a 3-2 victory over Chile in the South American Davis Cup tennis semifinal.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Brazil, April 6 (UPI) Tom Koch beat Jaime Fillol today in the final singles, 6-I, 6-3, 4-6, 4-6, 8-6, to give Brazil a 3-2 victory over Chile in the South American Davis Cup tennis semifinal.

headline.main: BRAZIL TOPS CHILE IN CUP TENNIS, 3-2; Koch Wins Deciding Singles From Fillol in 5 Sets

docs.snippet: MONTEGO BAY, Jamaica, April 6 (AP) Editors and publishers belonging to the Inter-American Press Association were told today that freedom of press in the Western Hemisphere "is at the lowest ebb since World War II."
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEGO BAY, Jamaica, April 6 (AP) Editors and publishers belonging to the Inter-American Press Association were told today that freedom of press in the Western Hemisphere "is at the lowest ebb since World War II."

headline.main: ATTACKS ON PRESS IN AMERICAS DECRIED

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 8  The United States and the countries of Latin America are nearing agreement on a major increase in the lending resources of the Inter-American Development Bank.  WASHINGTON, April 8  Profits of manufacturing corporations in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 8 The United States and the countries of Latin America are nearing agreement on a major increase in the lending resources of the Inter-American Development Bank. WASHINGTON, April 8 Profits of manufacturing corporations in the last quarter of 1969 were about 6 per cent below those of a year earlier, both before and after taxes, the Federal Trade Commission and Securities and Exchange Commission reported today.
docs.abstract: Inter-Amer Development Bank pres Herrera says US and Latin-Amer countries are planning to increase lending resources of bank, news conf; amts and manner of US contribution described; final agreement on proposal will be sought at forthcoming meeting of bank's govs

headline.main: Article 2 -- No Title; U.S. and Other Nations Plan to Increase Resources of Area Development Bank

byline.original: By EDWIN L. DALE Jr. Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, April 11-- Thomas A. Marshall Jr., man  aging director of the American Society for Testing and Materials, died Thursday of cancer in Hahnemann Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived in Radnor.
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, April 11-- Thomas A. Marshall Jr., man aging director of the American Society for Testing and Materials, died Thursday of cancer in Hahnemann Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived in Radnor.

headline.main: Thomas Marshall Jr., 59, Dead; Director of Society for Testing

docs.snippet: HAMILTON, Bermuda, April 12 Arthur Ashe of the United States won the Bacardi open invitational round-robin tennis tournament today and the $2,250 first prize by defeating Yugoslavia's No. 1 player, Zeljko Franulovic, 8-6, 7-5.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAMILTON, Bermuda, April 12 Arthur Ashe of the United States won the Bacardi open invitational round-robin tennis tournament today and the $2,250 first prize by defeating Yugoslavia's No. 1 player, Zeljko Franulovic, 8-6, 7-5.

headline.main: BERMUDA TENNIS CAPTURED BY ASHE; Beats Franulovic, 8-6, 7-5, in Final of Bacardi Open
